column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Went to hospital with migrain they gave me this medication for a migrain ?? I was totally out of it for 3 days sleeping the whole time .

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went to ER last nite, thought was my MS (have had optic neuritis in past) but also have severe reoccurring migraines. Dr said would treat me for migraine when eye exam was normal calling this a migraine variant due to severe eye pain after eye exam to check for damage cornea etc(it was same eye as I usually get bugged with both with my migraines and MS) but felt different this time. So I was given 25mg bendryl as well as this IV push. It seemed to work. It just made me SOOO tired that couldnt even send my hubby a quick text to tell him that I was ok (he took the kid home as he wouldnt handle waiting in the ER waiting room for hours easy). It left me exhausted though but not truly so sure how much was treatment vs pain during day exhaustion or combo). Eye pain coming back now, figures its 24hrs later. I have taken compazine and reglan in past and both caused extreme anxiety attacks. Glad this didnt now that I've read other reviews. I do believe that we should get informed choices whenever possible but not everyone will react to every drug same also.  This med also toned down my tinnitus (which is thought could be migraine related as well) so will go ahead and try another med that my ENT neuro specialist recommended at my last visit also now.  Yeah yeah know I am a neurological mess.

column2: iridaeza, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went to ER for severe headache, night sweats, feverish feelings. Recent trip to remote areas of Mexico, sprung thoughts of possible Malaria. Was given IM Droperidol to relieve headache pain. Within 3 to 5 minutes symptoms of extreme anxiety, crawling out of skin, bright lights, hot flash-extremely horrible feeling of being out of control, wanted to leave, heartrate by monitor was in the high 130's(before shot was in the 80's). Dr. and nurse did not seem alarmed by my reaction to the medication! IV of normal saline was then started and I was given an IV push of 25mg Benadryl. Still felt weird the next day and will NEVER take this medication or anything related to this med ever again!!

column2: KMC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this drug in the ER for a migraine with nausea and vomiting and had an adverse reactaion of high anxiety, restlessness with inability to sit still.   It also didnt help with the headache or nausea at all.

column2: Indiana Jones, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was in the ER for heart arrhythmia, pain, and a severe headache. The doctor thought I was anxious, as well, but I am just normally a fast talker and I was in pain. The ER doctor gave me this medication and said it was for pain. Apparently, this is not a pain medication. Within 5 minutes, I was having difficulty breathing and became out of touch with reality. I became very agitated with restless leg, tachycardia, and confusion. I felt I was going to pass out or die. This medication was derived in Hell. My ER doctor was not being honest in why he administered this medication. Patients NEED to ask "why" before medications are administered. We have the right.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been given this med at the ER and Urgent care for severe migraines both times I had a addverse reaction that lasted days I was anxious, drowsy but couldn't sleep this med brought on diarhea I couldn't eat or get of bed for days.

column2: neil, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: doctor prescribed this orally for equilibrium  it has no flavor and i think it is a placebo

column2: boo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was in terrible pain after rotator cuff surgery was given this in ER it calmed me down

column2: Diedre Lee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had an IV of Droperidol, It was given as a treatment for nausea before starting a headache treatment. I never received the treatment for the headache due to the fact that halfway through the Droperidol, I could no longer breathe, I also felt as though I was losing my mind.My son and daughter in law had to go get the nurse. They insisted she remove the IV. It took me 2 days to feel like I was even alive.

I was given Droperidol injection prior to an arteriogram procedure in the hospital.  The drug had an adverse reaction that caused BP to fall to 80/30s and extreme anxiety.  Physician injected another drug to reverse condition.

column2: nanabuggsomd, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this to relieve a migraine headache that also had nausea and vomitting. I got no relief from the HA, and ended up having to go back 3 days later to relieve the headache and anxiety caused by this drug. I was unable to sit still,sleep or anything for 3 days. Come to find out I am allergic to the drug.... NASTY thing to go through

column9: I was given this drug in the ER and within minutes I suffered Anaphylatic Shock, which caused me to be hospitalized for two days.
